blurb: You stress. Your friends stress. Your cells stress. Learn how cells keep calm by methylating mRNAs.
description: When cells are exposed to acute stresses they react with a series of molecular events collectively termed the 'cellular stress response.' Scientists in the Jaffrey group have revealed a novel method to fine-tuning the specific production of stress response proteins in a process they call m6A cap-independent translation.
title: Keep Calm and Methylate On
